title: Tony Forster Logotype Font
content:
What is the font on which is based the word rogue?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [i\_forster1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/typophile.com/files/i_forster1_5.jpg) | 51.44 KB |
author: aneta

comments.content: You can see the logo on the attached image
You can see the logo on the attached image

Sorry, don't know the answer and doubt actually there's one. I'm pretty convinced this is no font but a custom lettering by [Anthony Forster](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.artbyforster.com/) himself.  
Reminds me of [Thalia](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/thalia) though. There are also [Mikado](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/?q=mikado)/OPTI [Miyako](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/?q=miyako)/Scriptorium [Cipango](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/?q=cipango)/Solotype [Emperor](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/?q=emperor) without being any of them of course... May be they inspired him to create this lettering...  
Another one: [Letterhead](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803055700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/coffee-bin-fonts/letterhead) by Coffee Bin
I imagined that there is no indentical font, but I was looking for something similar, so You answered my question. Thank You
